Description: Black-topped vase of Nile silt pottery with convex sides, small lip rim, coated on exterior with red slip, blackened at rim and upper body, and well burnished. Interior is plain.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Marked ‘1817 Redim’ on base Identified as Black-top ware B25e in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery by E. Baumgartel in Petrie’s Naqada Excavations: A Supplement (London 1970), p. lix; however, more similar to B74c.
